title.narrative: Increased OPCAT ratification, in particular in MENA (2), Asia-Pacific (3) and influential countries in Africa (2) with APT contribution
Increased OPCAT ratification, in particular in MENA (2), Asia-Pacific (3) and influential countries in Africa (2) with APT contribution

target.value: 3 new ratifications of the OPCAT. by APT’s target countries

actual.value: -Australia: ratification in December -Sri Lanka and State of Palestine ratified in 2017 -Canada: announced engagement with provinces on OPCAT ratification. Consultations started and the Department of Justice requested the APT to provide technical advice. APT participated via Skype in the first consultation meeting between the Canadian Government and a core group of civil society organisations (CSOs) invited to advise the authorities in the first steps of the ratification process. -South Africa: new momentum on OPCAT ratification following the UPR; submission paper on NPM option to NHRI; jointly with the NHRI. organisation of 1 day closed working meetings with authorities on OPCAT implementation in November -Indonesia: OPCAT ratification accepted following the UPR review; advocacy on OPCAT with parliamentarians. August; workshop on strategy for ratification and implementation with the five institutions that could form the future NPM.

title.narrative: Number of actions taken by stakeholders working on vulnerabilities and on detention issues to protect persons deprived of their liberty in situation of vulnerability, such as women, LGBTI, persons with mental health issues, migrants.
Increased number of NPMs that issue thematic reports and/or include specific chapters to their annual reports on vulnerabilities in detention.

target.value: 20 different NPMs write thematic reports on vulnerable groups in detention

actual.value: -Migrants: cooperation with the new Special Rapporteur on Torture in the organisation of Geneva consultation meeting on migration related torture and ill-treatment; participation in the Latin-America regional consultation. in Mexico (report to be published in march 2018). In the framework of the UN Global Compact on Migration. the APT wrote a position paper with seven key advocacy messages from a torture prevention perspective. Participation in the Council of Europe consultation meeting on the draft standards for administrative detention of migrants. -LGBTI: workshops on LGBTI in detention. with NGOs and monitoring bodies in Brazil; workshops with judges on custody hearing. including LGBTI -Persons with disabilities: publication of the Symposium report and video on monitoring psychiatric institutions. Hearing with CAT on the Symposium.

title.narrative: Increased number of NPMs monitoring regularly non-traditional places of detention
Increased number of NPMs monitoring regularly non-traditional places of detention

target.value: 3 extra NPMs have a strategic approach to follow-up on recommendations

actual.value: -Paraguay: support the National Preventive Mechanism in strengthening the institution strategic planning and to improve its follow-up to recommendations regarding police custody and preventive detention (March) -Georgia: the NPM developed internal guidelines on follow-up to recommendations. based on 3 workshops facilitated by the APT

title.narrative: Relevant stakeholders work towards a better understanding of safeguards
Relevant stakeholders work towards a better understanding of safeguards

target.value: 1 global and 3 national initiatives (Brazil. Madagascar. Fiji) to implement safeguards in practice

actual.value: Strategic expert meeting on the Special Rapporteur’s proposal to have a Universal Protocol on Investigative Interviewing -High level UN meeting on the Protocol in NYC; oral statement during the High Level event on torture at the UNGA on the development of standards and guidelines on investigative interviewing by the police; participation in the OHCHR Intersessional meeting on safeguards (following up on the HRC Resolution 31/31 -Joint call by the 4 Special Rapporteurs on Torture on investing more in safeguards to prevent torture and ill-treatment -Joint APT/ICRC expert roundtable on police custody with senior police officers from 27 countries -Paper on “safeguards in the first hours of police detention” for the CTI included in its UNCAT implementation tool -2 minutes animated video on safeguards
